concise_definition: adj. 收养的, 采用的, 被正式接受的

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to a child who has been legally taken into a family other than the biological one, and raised as a member of that family.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被法律程序正式收养，并在非亲生家庭中抚养长大的孩子。
definitions.example_en: She is an adopted daughter who grew up loving her parents just as much as any biological child.
definitions.example_cn: 她是一个被收养的女儿，长大后对养父母的爱丝毫不亚于亲生子女。

definitions.explanation_en: Something that has been formally chosen or accepted, especially a policy, method, or idea, after consideration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指经过考虑后正式选定或采纳的政策、方法或观念。
definitions.example_en: The company has adopted a new strategy to improve customer satisfaction.
definitions.example_cn: 该公司已采用了一项新策略以提升客户满意度。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to describe a practice, custom, or system that has been taken on by a group or individual, even if not originally theirs.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于描述某群体或个人采纳的习俗、做法或制度，即使这些并非其原本固有的。
definitions.example_en: The adopted tradition of lighting candles during the holiday has become central to the celebration.
definitions.example_cn: 在节日期间点蜡烛这一被采纳的传统已成为庆祝活动的核心。

comparison.analysis: “Foster” (寄养的) 指临时性的照顾安排，通常不涉及法律上的收养关系，孩子仍保留与原生家庭的法律联系。而 “adopted” 表示法律上完全的、永久性的亲子关系建立，原生父母的权利被终止。
“Accepted” (被接受的) 强调对某事物的认同或容忍，但不一定包含正式采纳或制度化的过程。而 “adopted” 暗示了经过决策、程序或仪式后的正式采用，更具主动性和规范性。
“Chosen” (被选择的) 侧重于从多个选项中做出偏好性决定，但不必然涉及正式实施或制度化。而 “adopted” 不仅意味着选择，还意味着将其纳入实践、体系或身份中，具有更强的行动后果。
